intro: Thesium, commonly known as the "devil's bit scarlet," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or herbs with small, often brightly colored flowers. The plants typically have dark green, leathery leaves and produce showy, bell-shaped blooms in shades of red, pink, or white. Thesium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in moist, acidic soils in woodlands or heathlands.
